pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:0.5: 12. The training rule on entirely black
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood near Vesālī,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.2: the monks from the group of six were having blankets made entirely of black wool.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.3: People who were walking about the dwellings complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.4: “How could the Sakyan monastics have blankets made entirely of black wool? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.5: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.6: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.7: “How could the monks from the group of six have blankets made entirely of black wool?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.8: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.12: “Foolish men, how could you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.14: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.15.1: ‘If a monk has a blanket made entirely of black wool, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.6: there are two kinds of black:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.9: it is made by strewing, not by weaving.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.11: if he makes the blanket, or has it made, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.12: When he gets the blanket, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.13: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.14: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.15: (To be expanded as in [Bu Np 1:3.2.5](pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.5)--3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.16: ‘Venerables, this blanket, which I got made entirely of black wool, is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.17: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.20: ‘I give this blanket back to you.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.21.1: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.22: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.23: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.24: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.25: If he makes one, or has one made, for someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.26: If he gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.28: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.30: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.31: The training rule on entirely black, the second, is finished.
